availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Married Lucretia Starnes Irvin in 1829 in Mercer County. Father of James F. Irvin, Sarah Irvin, Decy A. Irvin, Samuel W. Irvin, and Benjamin B. Irvin. Owned seven enslaved people in Mercer County in 1860. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 646
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191851, p. 51
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, page 6.
Find A Grave, "James B. Irvin (July 2, 1802-April 1, 1889)," Memorial #58178488, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58178488 (accessed October 9, 2019).
